page.title: 11KENDAL MATERNITY HOSPITAL.
page.content: { The Maternity Hospital}has stood for ninety-five years. Cotton merchants owned the building until 1892 when they handed it over to the health service and it was converted from a house into a hospital. There are ten wards and forty-five staff. The{operating theatre}and {labour ward}date from 1955 and the lift and fire escape from 1958. 1965 saw the addition of the{ante_ {natal clinic nursery and milk kitchen. while in 1967 new kitchens and staff dining facilities were added. In 1984 three{new delivery rooms}were opened, as well as an{admissions room and duty {station.}Today, a programme of repair is in constant operation. Two{babies}are born each day, most being allowed home during their first week. March is the busiest month for the hospital staff.
